name: Cynthia Isabella
review: Two months ago, I stayed at Tentrem Hotel Semarang with my family. When we first arrived, we were immediately greeted by the bellboy, who also carried our suitcases. Then, at check-in time, we were served quickly, so we didn't have to wait too long, and after that, we were escorted immediately to our room. At night, we ordered food at the hotel via the telephone. It didn't take a long time for the food to arrive in our room. The next morning, when I had breakfast at the hotel, the waiters there greeted me with a friendly greeting and immediately escorted us to an empty seat. Then, the waiter also offered coffee or tea, and it was brought directly to our table. During our 4 days there, we were served in a professional and friendly manner. Their professionalism and great service made us want to go back there.

name: I love Food
review: The rooms are spacious, clean, and very pretty. Although some of the paintings dod freak me out. Staff were very friendly. What stood out to me most is the breakfast! It felt very awkward swimming in front of people having breakfast. There's no seperation fence/plants, so people could easily come in and out of the breakfast place to the pool. The outdoor breakfast area and the pool is so uncomfortably close. But it's alright. The beautiful tile art in the pool made up for it. The water felt very fresh and nice, didn't feel oddly chemical ish like some pools do. It's across Tentrem mall and very near citraland so you have a variety of food choices near walking distance. There's lots of local street food near the hotel too. My stay at Tentrem Jogja was a 5/5 but I would give Tentrem Semarang a 4/5.

name: Samuel Lumentut
review: This is the most expensive hotel in Semarang. One group with Hotel Tentrem Jogja and Hotel Chanti not far from Hotel Tentrem Semarang. Own by Sido Muncul, the company who produces the world famous Tolak Angin brand. So where to start? Is it luxurious? You bet, service? Excellent, location? Almost all Semarang legendary foods are located within 15 to 20 minutes drive from the hotel which is Godsend. Breakfast? Although the international menus were a bit boring, they have stalls of more than 10 legendary Semarang food like Nasi Ayam Bu Pini, Gudeg Abimanyu, Asem Asem Koh Lim and many other. Oh don't forget to try their tolak angin ice cream. Its... Well ice cream with tolak angin taste... Literally. Its weird at first but its good the more you eat it. Pool also really great. Not too big but on 1 side they have transparent acrylic so it is so unique and cool to take photo at. The hotel is also connected directly to Tentrem mall. Upscale mall with not so many tenants but they have Ice Skating and cinema inside. They also have big aquarium with Arapaima fish native from Amazon river. Its great really. Alfamart is also like 25 steps away literally from hotel lobby should you want to buy water to stock into your room. Just perfect. So why 4 stars? Well.. Room is okay, aircon is cold. Bathroom also okay although the room that I stayed have no bathup. They have electric window that can be transparent or iced so you can't see inside. Pretty cool. The drapes are all provided by Serba Antik. The lifts also very high tech and basically has no button inside them. You push it outside the elevator where you wanna go. Very cool. They also give free minibar stocked with Sido Muncul products for you to try. So again why 4 stars? At this price I think the room should be a bit bigger, have bathup and fully carpeted. Granted they use some kind of marbles or Granite for the flooring, but for me personally plush carpet still make me feel like I'm in a 5 stars hotel instead of marbles or granite. The floor is cold to the touch always. If you use carpet it should be warm when you wanna just sit on the floor. Okay enough ranting. I'm kinda nitpicking over here. This hotel is not bad by any means. Might be the best in Semarang too, but well I'm not easily giving 5 stars anywhere. So this place should merit 4.5 stars for me. A great experience all in all... You should at least try once when you go to Semarang.

Complete facility for children and parent, large glass view swimming pool, playground, gym, jacuzzi, sauna. Forgot something? Breakfast is buffet type and has everything from continental to local Semarang delicacies and everything in between, even ice cream if you fancy your early dessert. Their barrister is also very good with their coffee creations, I love both their hot and cold coffees. They also has a great juice bar, sometimes making a acidic delight detox concoction. Even though we stayed during the high season when the hotel is fully booked, it's still easy to get help from the staff. review: It was my first time to stay in this hotel. I love the ambience and the design. I enjoyed the pool and the jacuzzi so much. The gym was also not bad. I just have an unpleasant experience during our check in. We booked 5 rooms in the same floor, and when we arrived from 6 hours drive at 2 p.m the rooms wasn't ready yet. We told them again we want all rooms in a row and they said it's no problem. At 3 p.m the staff told us only two rooms ready and we need to wait for few minutes for the other 3 rooms because we wanted it in a row so we decided to give the two rooms to our parents so they can rest. I said but the check in time is 3 p.m. She said it's because there was only two cleaning services in one floor. I just don't understand how can that be our problem but I just let it go. Few minutes later I heard the staff who serve us told her friend to tell other staff that the rooms was booked by us and to not give it to other guest. And few minutes from that the staff told us that we can't get the room in a row. And if we want to get a room in a same floor, we need to wait another half an hour. I was dissapointed because I know they probably gave our booked room to another guest after we stand waiting for more than an hour but we were all tired for the long drive and we didn't get our room yet so we decided to have some rest in the two rooms while waiting for the other rooms to be ready and the staff promised us to deliver the other rooms key to our room at 16.15. But we waited and nobody came and we need to call them again before they finally come and give us the rest of the room keys. When I get to my room, I saw yellow stain in our closet. It was easily removed by wet tissue, but it was gross and I just don't think it should happen. I think the room service was in a hurry to prepare the room. So yeah the hotel is very nice, they just need to improve the service, especially the front desk and cleaning service. I still give them a five star because I really like the hotel and hope it was just a one time mistake, they will improve and it won't happen again to anyone.

hotel_name: Hotel Ciputra Semarang managed by Swiss-Belhotel International
name: Muhammad Iskandar
review: Location was good. Easy access to mall and to get food. I appreciate the welcome drink that was available almost all the time - bir pletok, a non alcoholic local beer? But I had to wait for almost 15 minutes for omelette - standing. And nobody offered to send to my table. Poor service I'd say for a hotel this standard.

hotel_name: Hotel Ciputra Semarang managed by Swiss-Belhotel International
name: Kris Hadis
review: Still my favorite hotel in Semarang due to the great service attitude from the staff. However, the bathrooms need a total refurbishment as they are old and some parts are broken. The amenities are very standard and lacking, for a so called 4 star hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Ciputra Semarang managed by Swiss-Belhotel International
name: MPC Autowork TV
review: Sure the hotel is quite a hotel, but it is starting to show it's age. Nonetheless it is one of the best hotel in town. Located in the heart of Semarang's iconic Simpang Lima, this hotel is connected to a mall next to it. So, when the you're lack of supplies and clothings then this is the hotel for you. It has a decent bakery and restaurant.

hotel_name: Hotel Ciputra Semarang managed by Swiss-Belhotel International
name: Theo Hari
review: Luxurious and modern hotel in Semarang. Integrated with a good mall with branded stuff.

hotel_name: Hotel Ciputra Semarang managed by Swiss-Belhotel International
name: Edwin Nugroho
review: As of the star level of this hotel, im gonna give it 4 stars too.. Hotel with a super great location. Located in the heart of the Semarang City and surrounded by 2 malls beside this Hotel. And you can also have so many culinary at the tavern around simpang 5. So much pleasures you can get when you stay here. But i think the hotel needs a renovation and newer design and furnishing stuff. So it will be more comfortable to stay at. Anyway so much satisfied to stay here. Thank you Ciputra Hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Ciputra Semarang managed by Swiss-Belhotel International

review: Came here only for workshop, and stayed at other place. So far so good, this hotel has direct access to the mall, and the hospitality was great. Once i left my charger and they saved it, roll it with some tape diligently.. I never did that to mine though.. Haha..

hotel_name: Hotel Ciputra Semarang managed by Swiss-Belhotel International
name: Ajie Isdianto
review: Pretty good for an old building. But be aware that the online booking service provides no options to choose between smoking or non-smoking room, you have to make the optional request probably by phone or e-mail. Because I checked-in late at night, they don't have a non-smoking room available, I had to stay for a night in a smoking room that doesn't have exhaust system nor windows that can be opened. Thankfully the problem resolved in the next morning.

hotel_name: Hotel Ciputra Semarang managed by Swiss-Belhotel International
name: Shane Faulkwell
review: The hotel is a little dated, but it's always a nice place to stay in Semarang.

name: Iqbal Bagus Alfiansyah
review: Stayed here last July for two nights with my family. I had also stayed here in 2010, nine years prior (!). The hotel remains as a gem in central Semarang, situated just across Simpang Lima and directly connected to Mall Ciputra. Our spacious room was on the tenth floor with the Executive Lounge located just next to the lift corridor. Plenty of choices of breakfast, although the restaurant itself is actually quite small. The pool is located on the 4th floor but I did not try it out

hotel_name: Hotel Ciputra Semarang managed by Swiss-Belhotel International
name: Avissa Suseno
review: Been staying at this hotel for about 4 nights. It's 5 stars hotel that's opposite to Simpang Lima. It was quite a good experience since they provided us with the daily welcome drink that was Beer Plethok (Traditional beverage) at the lobby and you can take it as much as you wanted. They also provided you with toiletries everyday, kettle, coffee and tea bag, cup and glass. Unfortunately the shower wasn't as heavy as we expected and also the room wasn't opposite to Simpang Lima. This hotel also can help you to access to the Citraland Mall from the lobby since they have door that can lead you to the mall straight away. You don't have to pay for deposit, that's good.

hotel_name: Hotel Ciputra Semarang managed by Swiss-Belhotel International

name: B. Jonathan T.
review: Used to be a quite fancy hotel. The lobby still looks premium but the ceiling has been water damaged and looks deteriorating. Once you enter the room it feels as budgety as a budget hotel. Cool white lights make it feel a little cheap, no real mugs in the room only paper cups and cheap plastic cups in the bathroom. The floor used to be made of carpet and contrasted with ceramic, now replaced with regular ceramic tiles for the whole room, they removed the bath tub and replaced it with a shower only. They removed the wallpapers and painted the walls brownish white. Much more to rant about for my disappointment. Overall it is a good hotel but as a person who used to go here all the time this makes me very sad and disappointed, They gutted almost everything that makes me enjoy staying here. Definitely no longer a 4 star hotel in terms of room feel except for the spacious rooms. The service and food still remains excellent as always.

review: Great clean room, great food and great service. The room is classicly designed, more soundproofed than most of the hotels i stayed on, quite spacious with a divan near the window so you can lay and watch the view. Nice bathroom and very comfy bed. There's a book store next door if you want to pick some reading or stationeries. This hotel is always be my top choice whenever i travel to Semarang.

name: Teguh Sunyoto
review: At check in, we asked receptionist to store breast milk in their freezer (we also already wrote word "freezer" in the plastic milk container) as we plan for 2 nights stay. For the information, it was a 700ml breast milk that was pumped by my wife during our 4 days trip prior to arriving to this hotel. In fact, we have also asked this (whether the hotel can store breast milk in their freezer) via phone before we book the room, and they confirm providing the service for their guest. It turned out, at check out, the hotel staff did not store our breast milk in the freezer instead they store it in a chiller and as a result our breast milk spoiled and can no longer be used/given to our baby. All the hotel staffs did just say sorry without any explanation, they don't understand how much effort my wife have done to pump that breast milk during our trip. The above was not the only disappointing experiences we had in this hotel.. on the morning when we ready to go for breakfast the electricity suddenly turn off for almost 1 hour.. as a result we must go down to the restaurant from 6th floor using emergency stair. Btw, I have my parent (78 and 65 years old) with me and also a 3 month baby with its stroller. This was a terrible experiences for our family. We also have to eat our breakfast without light. Overall, awful experiences in this hotel. Will definitely never go back..

review: Santika Premiere was an old hotel that tried to has to competes with other new hotels in the center of Semarang city. The management applied generous and hospitality principle to the guest in order to fulfil the good image to their guests. The front desk staffs were good and responsive. The room was spacious and neat. The breakfast was delicious and provide many options of traditional dan contine tal menus. Event though, the maintenance of the room dan bathroom needed to improve because the bedcover was not change every day, the aircondition only operate in high speed fan mode, the towels spotted with dirty stain, and the shower taps were not postioned well (the shower switch was blocked by the hot water switch). The amenities were minimal.

review: Had a really great time staying in this hotel, rooms clean & quite big, although a bit old, breakfasts great, lots of variety, only thing is that we couldn't get connecting rooms/next to each other and our room smelled smoke although it was a non smoking room.

review: I waited for about 20 minutes to get into my room during the high season but the recepcionist was friendly so i didnt get mad even though im tired. The room is quiet nice. But the information form the website has some differences with the real condition. The website says that i'll get a balcony and a bathup. But i got no balcony and a shower bathroom. And they dont even have a safety box in my room. But they have a cooler so you can store your beer bottles. Despite all of above, this hotel is in strategic place so you can reach some places by foot if you want to. The breakfast is quiet nice. Thank you.

name: Leo Josaphat
review: feel hommy, staffs were so helpful, nice, great nuance and ambience when you stay there. We've got welcome chese cake and it was yummy, thanks so much Santika Semarang , we'll stay again someday.

name: Mia Fitriyanti
review: from the room I stayed, the furniture seemed too old fashion, the pillow was slightly dirty, and at least I found 2 little bugs looked like cockroaches. The bathroom on the other hand, seemed modern and decent. The breakfast was okay and so was the swimming pool.

review: During business trip, I often stay in Santika. Loves the breakfast section. Always many chioces and serve traditional food. Today i found pecel and nasi ayam, kupat tahu Bandung and bubur traditional for dessert. Staffs always helpful anf feel at home here. Room always clean and spacious. I got 815 room which facing stadion. Great view.

name: Hardono arivianto
review: It's been a while since my kidney transplant that i manage not to go out from my home town especially during this covid 19 pandemic, until sometimes this week i've to go to Semarang for official duty, no need to think directly i booked Santika, and what a surprised than when check in i've to declared my health status dan asked wether i've take the swab antigen recently which is THIS IS A GOOD think. Entering rooms, there is a pair of medical mask,a paper cup for coffee, plastic cup in bathroom which is according to me one of the anticipation during the pandemic When taking sahur i'm also experiencing a good example of safety precautions from Santika, still in buffet style but the Santika staff wearing hand gloves will get what want behind the stall, so no need to worry that other guest already touch the pan, tea pot and other. It is nice to be back to Santika Premiere Semarang

name: Bayu Amus
review: Sits near Simpang Lima where you can find a lot of attractions on weekends, and lots of street food choices at night. Delicious fulfilling breakfast with various selection of local traditional dishes. Building is considerably aged but well maintained, and service was good. No convenience store nearby though, hence replenishing daily supplies is an issue.

Office buildings, business center, modern shopping malls, cinema and other entertainments are also surrounding. Located exactly in the heart of the city, makes your stay of business trip or weekend getaway just perfect.

name: Victor Abraham
review: Not really bad, cause it only takes a few minutes to Simpang Lima Semarang.

name: Joris Sodenkamp
review: This hotel was our worst experience in Indonesia. When we arrived everything looked perfect, spacious room and a beautiful pool on the roof terrace. After spending a day in the city we found out that our room was full of cockroaches. Families were crawling up the walls and into our bags. They offered us to move to another room but we couldn't trust that another part of the hotel wasn't the same. We had to unpack everything to make sure that didn't any roaches with us. We decided to move to another clean hotel and requested a full refund. They initially told us that this was not possible but we were persistent and got our money back. We were really disappointed because the price of a room gives the impression that this hotel is more luxurious. Unfortunately this is not the case. However, the front desk agent was really helpful with the refund and the hotel is well located in the city.

name: Rendi Suwardi
review: The room is nice, spacious and clean. However I was disappointed with the elevator, they provide only two elevators and they are small, kinda slow.. Before I stayed there i have read from other guests about the small parking space. But never thought it was that narrow.

name: Rianda Rizza
review: Perfect stay with a little annoying hiccups. The room was excellent, the staffs are super friendly and helpful. No complain at all. The only issue is their parking space which is worst than a corn field maze. If got a space to part on the higher level, then prepare about 30 to 45 minutes just to get out. name: James M.
review: the bathroom is small, there's no door for the shower. The hotel has very awful hygeine, some 3 stars hotel are better than this, the room is quite big but empty. It also has a quite bad smell in the bathroom. Overall this hotel just needs to improve their hygiene. It was dissappointing. Trash can was full of trash from previous guests. The chair is very rough and pointy. The tv screen was laggy, the fps dropped. Too much dust, I sneezed a lot. AC works fine, spacious enough yet crammed. Would not come here again until the hotel learns how to clean properly.

name: Andi R
review: Im enjoying my stay for 2 days in semarang with this hotel, located at simpang lime. A very active place during weekend especially with their car free days. As much as i enjoy staying here, i had terrible experience with some of the facilities such as hotel rooms that unable to open due to door malfunction, a dirty swimming pool and squeaking lift. Gratefully theyre able to upgrade my room to bigger space for the room technical issue, the pool is public area with no regulation for people to wash before swim hence so many hair and dirts in the pool. on the other hand, the lift need serious maintenance it squeaking as hell. Their service is exceptional yet id like them to do maintenance and evaluate their facilities

name: Sardjito Imam
review: End of July, we stayed on Floor 20, 1BR Studio Connecting - Apartment Louis Kiene Simpang Lima. Room cleanliness and facilities 8 out of 10 - Sheets, pillowcases, mattresses are fragrant and not many spots. TV don't expect much, just local entertainment. - Wall Paper in some places peeling and blotchy. Cleaning and kitchen utensils 6 out of 10 - In the kitchen drawer there is a container for used zinc rust, spots and smells as well as a lot of small animals, sticky pan and spatula are not suitable for use) Cleanliness and bathroom facilities 7 out of 10 - Bathroom Facilities 6 out of 10 (Hot water only lasts 1 minute of use) Many bathroom flies enter the room and kitchen, it is recommended to bring fly and mosquito spray Parking 5 of 10 - Included in the category of the most dangerous apartment for SUV car operators and above, because access to the ramp down and up the car park must be accompanied by a parking attendant, the distance between the wall and the car body is only in the range of 5 - 6 CM left and right with minimal maneuvering, It is not recommended for Beginner drivers and SUV units with a wider and longer body than the 2020 Toyoya KIjang Innova Reborn. - Parking lot is good, enough space between cars to park. The best facilities are in the swimming pool ares, the best view to see the city of Semarang is more than 180 degrees, comfortable, clean and homey seats.

name: Mariana Diah Rahmawati
review: I am extremely dissapointed with the service of this hotel. I have booked and fully paid last night, but because of the traffic jam from Jakarta to Semarang, we were exhausted. So we had to sleep at a rest area, and we had to take breakfast first. We already called the hotel at around 10.00 am, saying that we needed the room to take refreshment only. The front office said that it's ok, checkout can be arranged at 1.00 pm. But when I finally arrived at the hotel at around 12.40 pm, a front office receptionist named Winda said that my room was already checked out automatically at 12.00 pm. I said I already called and was told that it's ok. How can they give my room (210) to another person? No good answer from the front office. I was really dissapointed. We were really tired and exhausted, and were denied a little hospitality. In the end, we had to book another hotel near by.

name: Adi Dbgad

name: Derk Wolters
review: We booked a suite for one weekend. Found the suite clean but outdated. Uncomfortable furniture, very limited coffee and tea facility and no minibar. Food that was served in restaurant downstairs was covered with plastic. And whilst we were eating they were already setting tables for the breakfast. Very noisy. Food in skylounge was also not good steak I ordered was cold and the food we ordered cam out not all together but in two servings. For the amount of money I pay for one night , over 4 million idr, it is certainly not worth it. Found the staff not interested with the guests. Not once we were asked if everything was OK. Even at the checking out the receptionist didn't even ask how our stay was and if we enjoyed staying in their hotel. Will not be going back for sure, there are much better hotels to stay in semarang and for a much better and fairer price.

name: hendro mulyo
review: Room is nice and clean, hot water is sufficient. But, breakfast and food over all is not as good as rooms. And staff hospitality to guest should be improved, a lot

name: Lana Nurdewi
review: The room (deluxe twin) is quite spacious even with an extra bed. The room facilities all work well and well maintained. The most important is the location. It's in the heart of Semarang.

name: Philippe Auberger
review: Smoking room. Super hold. Holes on the carpet. Exhausted furniture. A no go.Went to their skyline restaurant, fine dining.....a real joke. Despite friendly staff the rest is just a disaster. Frozen vegies amd fries. Anyway first and last.

name: Henry Harlim
review: The hotel services was very good. Room are so big. Will be stay again here next time.

name: Ira Wardhani
review: Modern and nice hotel for family vacation. The room is quite spacious, with separate shower and bath tub. Check in process is quite sufficient, the receptionist was asking for our rapid test's paper due to covid 19 (which we don't mind at all) so the hotel guests can stay in this hotel safe and comfortable.

name: Adri Kharismanto
review: One of the best hotel in Semarang. Rooms are nice, staffs are friendly, the gym almost felt like professional, and breakfast is outstanding.

name: Michael Darmawan
review: As this is my 2nd experience to be in Semarang. I can say that this hotel is very strategic, especially to experience many culinary spots (online or on the spot). With great service and very clean accomodation, I am sure to go back here again on my future visit to Semarang.

name: Cliff Gerardo
review: Lovely hotel, well, it SHOULD be as Semarang‚Äôs best 5 star hotel. Got checked-in quickly, trip to my room was fast and efficient because of their 4 elevators. My room was pretty clean. Carpets are not though, but I can still get by it. They provide a lot of amenities in the bathroom which is always a great thing. Bath tub was clean too. Let‚Äôs not forget beds. They have the comfiest beds I‚Äôd argue. Staff since I walked through the door were very helpful and friendly If I do say so myself. Although the Cascade restaurant was closed for renovations during my visit. I still enjoyed the food they served in the Polaris Room 3rd floor. Pool and Gym was great! 5 stars from me!

name: Tania Pratiwi
review: For the room very clean and comfortable, the amenities are complete. Loved it. The only one that bothers me is breakfast time. Cause the ballroom and one of the restaurants is under maintaining, so the breakfast move to 3rd floor and it's a really small capacity and easy to full, so we are directed to 2nd floor, their backup place for breakfast. The foods have not many variants just like the 3rd floor, and the staff is careless and there is no clear signage where when the elevator is open. Really disappointed üôÅ

At breakfast they give me ramen with udon noodles. When i ask for chilli flakes they give me sambal from bakso? How come you mix ramen and sambal bakso. Lol.

name: Halim Ashari
review: Poor hotel SOP. They have very friendly and polite staffs but because the SOP is somewhat muddled they look bad. My first experience when staying at this so call 5 star hotel.

review: very affordable for 5 star hotel. the price in the menu are includes tax and service. close order for beverages is at 11pm, and drinks is at 11.30pm

name: Nikki Liem
review: Have stayed here twice and I think the next time we go to Semarang again, will surely stay here again! Staff were undoubtedly helpful and friendly. Room was spacious, 6 bottles of mineral water (2 were cold in the mini fridge!). Water kettle was almost broken but still functional on my second stay. Room and the hotel was very clean, hand sanitizer easy to access. Felt very safe here during pandemic. The bottom of our shoes were sprayed upon arrival. During breakfast service, staff can be seen actively helping guests and cleaning up. Food was awesome. Ordered oxtail soup and macncheese to our room and they came fast, very tasty (did not taste like "hotel food" but more like home cooking, even the bfast food too!). Thanks so kuch Gumaya Tower hotel, can't wait to stay there again!

name: Saiful Anam

Even, the security sprayed your shoe sole as if the virus brought under your shoe LOL...good job. It made me feel more comfort and secure.

name: Ardy Prasetya

name: Tommy Setiawan

The swimming pool, spa and fitness were great and the food taste very good too !

name: Aris B Nugroho

name: Agatha Claudia
review: Location : very strategic, within walking distance to some famous culinary destination Room : no complaint, very spacious, bathroom clean spacious, bed are comfy, amenities everything fit the description of 5 star hotel. Service is great, fast. They have many facilities, swimming pool but not too wide, fitness center with spa and sauna, they also provide shoes in case you use sandals. Price compare to Jakarta, ofc it's very affordable , if you visit Semarang and you wanted to stay in an affordable 5 star hotel, this is it

name: my TaRaka
review: Realy amazed with the details. They arranged a diferent tile in the bathroom, unslipery for the shower room, comfort bathtub, lots of mineral water to drink (they gave 6 bottles). They even put the information on the lamps buttons, so I dont have to klick it many times, guessing which button for wich lamps. The room is cozy, bright and spacious. The hospitality is great. Food are amazing, lots of choises and it taste good. Gym and the pool were quite good. Surely will coming back here.

name: Tomi Satryatomo
review: One of the best places to stay in Semarang, especially if you need to be close to the downtown area. Only take a few minutes to walk to the famous Simpang Lima, the iconic roundabout considered as the center of Semarang, with the mystical Lawang Sewu (a thousand doors) building on one of the sides. The room is neatly arranged, the bed is comfortable, the breakfast is nice and the service is superb. Everything you could expect from a 5 stars hotel. The only downside is the swimming pool which length is only about 5 meters. Due to the pandemic, the hotel implements strict regulations. Mask is expected to be worn at all times. In the restaurant, you're not allowed to take the food by yourself. Someone is always ready to cater to your need. Tables and chairs are put at a distance.

name: Binod Ojha
review: Nice hotel with the good services by hotel staff. Easy to reach mall and food. A lots of variety food in the breakfast but it more to local food which is not really international buffet. They serve buffet for the dinner on Friday and Saturday with reasonable price and delicious. So you should try it. The problem is only to go to GF Lobby, you have to change 2 lift the reach there.

review: The most luxurious hotel in Semarang city. Located in a very strategic area in Gajahmada street that is super accessible from the city center. Like any other city style hotel, they don't have a wide area of courtyard that make it a bit crowded when there is an event inside attended by many guests. The interior design is also modern and luxurious. The room rate is fair according to the season

review: A high end hotel within the sleepy city of Semarang. I enjoyed my stay here and the value for money for the quality of the rooms was good. The staff were attentive and their restaurants were pretty good. Buffet was really cheap and offered a fair amount of choice from various cuisines. Location is near the famous weekend night market which houses a huge number of stalls for street food within their little chinatown. It is also near Paragon Mall. Overall can't fault much for the price of the rooms at which I got mine for.

review: Going to bukber event at Marquess. My favorite so far is chicken quesadillas, beef wellington, balinese grilled fish, chicken satay, and their sushi is also nice. review: Location is in center of town though no shopping mall in walking distance. Big room, spacious bathroom and great breakfast, although a little crowded during the Muslim Holidays week. I love this place.

name: Lumi Loo
review: Decent size rooms for a 5 star hotel outside the capital. Prices are fine, BEWARE that the hotel only assigns ONE floor for smokers. Receptionist claims that you've to call ahead and confirm, yet my room was denied to me even after a verbal confirmation of availability. There was no upgrades or compensation offered, but the hotel moved us to a smoking room the next day. They've also managed to lose a charger of mine during the room transfer. If you insist on a local experience, go for it, but this hotel won't be my first choice on the list. I've had better experience with other hotels in the area. (Crowne was a significantly better experience, not sure about its current state after they changed management to PO hotels.)

name: George Adriaansz
review: This new hotel might be the best among other hotels in Semarang city. The building was new, the front desk staffs are friendly and responsive, there were four lifts to serve the hotel guest uo and down, the breakfast room was spacious and offered various menus to satisfy our taste buds. The room was spacious, well furnished, and amenities were complete and good. No restaurants surround this hotel that could reach walkable, so the guests had two options to have dinner, go to hotel restaurant or go to other redtaurants by taxi or on line rental vehicle
